items.sentence: I lay in bed thinking about everything that had happened that day.
I now understand that the woman I thought was a nurse is a doctor.
She asked him to read it for her because she had lost her glasses.
The girl Tom was beginning to love was beginning to love him, too.
I assume they chose Tom because he\'s the best person for the job.
Tom said that Mary was driving the car when the accident happened.
Tom showed Mary the note that he found under his windshield wiper.
Tom took some papers out of his briefcase and showed them to Mary.
Tom is one of the students that I\'m teaching French to this year.
Tom knew he didn\'t have enough money to buy everything he needed.
Tom was pulled over by a policeman who gave him a speeding ticket.
Tom was surprised to see Mary out jogging so early in the morning.
Tom was talking with those strangers over there just a minute ago.
Tom was the only one who knew how to start a fire without matches.
I haven\'t been back to Boston since I graduated from high school.
I think Tom doesn\'t speak French very well, but I could be wrong.
Tom could use a little extra time to review for the upcoming test.
Tom decided that it would be fun to go camping with John and Mary.
Do you really think Tom is the only one here who can speak French?
Have you ever heard of the story of the little boy who cried wolf?
I always watch the weather report before going out in the morning.
Tom says he wasn\'t here yesterday. It must\'ve been someone else.
Tom lived in Boston for three years before moving back to Chicago.
Tom might have survived if the paramedics had gotten there faster.
Tom opened the glove compartment and got out a pair of sunglasses.
Tom ought not to have spoken to his teacher in that tone of voice.
Tom wanted to prove to his friends and family that he could do it.
Though she did not wear expensive clothes, she was neatly dressed.
It might not have been as difficult to do that as Tom said it was.
You had just enough time to drive to Boston and commit the murder.
You should be ashamed of yourselves after the way you treated Tom.
Tom borrowed some books from the library to read over the weekend.
Tom and Mary just got married, but they don\'t act like newlyweds.
There weren\'t any passengers on the bus at the time of the crash.
Tom yelled something in French just before he dove into the water.
Tom wanted to take a picture of Mary, but she didn\'t want him to.
I thought I told you I didn\'t want you to talk to Tom about that.
I don\'t think that I\'ll be able to solve this problem by myself.
Tom asked his mother if he could spend the night at John\'s house.
Tom couldn\'t think of any reason for not giving Mary the present.
There wasn\'t enough time to do everything that needed to be done.
You\'re not likely to be able to convince Tom to do that, are you?
After being in a coma for three weeks, Tom regained consciousness.
Everyone\'s laughing, but no one will explain to me what happened.
I can\'t help thinking what Tom would say if he saw me doing this.
I can\'t possibly afford to pay for the operation my mother needs.
Tom and Mary both studied French at the same university in Boston.
Tom could barely make ends meet when he was in his early twenties.
Just be glad Tom didn\'t tell Mary what you really thought of her.
Tom\'s flashlight died on him before he could get out of the cave.
